Shift

The base class for shifts.

Summary
ShiftThe base class for shifts.
Functions
setFocusRegionsTakes a variable list of DOM element that will trigger this shift to fire an onFocus event.
editThe shift should present it’s editing interface.
refreshYou should always provide some kind of refresh function so that your shift can correct itself for resize operations, window size changs, showing, hiding, etc.
onFocusDo any updating of the shift’s interface here.
unfocusTell ShiftSpace we want to blur this shift.
onBlurDo any updating of the shift’s interface here.
getMainViewReturns the main view of the shift.
mainViewIsVisibleReturns whether the main view is visible or not.
pinPins an element of the shift to a node on the page.
unPinUnpins an element of this shift from a element on the page.
setPinElementSet the element of the shift that will actually be pinned.
getPinElementReturns the current element that is pinned.
setPinRefSet the current pinRef object.
getPinRefReturns the set pinRef object if this shift has one.
getEncodablePinRefThis returns a version of the pin reference object that is encodable.
setPinTargetSets the pin target.
getPinTargetReturns the current pin target if there is one.
setPinTargetStylesWhen replacing a target node or being inserted before or after it is important to pick up some of the CSS dimensions of that target node.
getPinTargetStylesReturns the JSON object of the target nodes CSS dimension styles.
isPinnedReturns true if this shift is currently pinned.

Functions

setFocusRegions

setFocusRegions : function()

Takes a variable list of DOM element that will trigger this shift to fire an onFocus event.

edit

edit: function()

The shift should present it’s editing interface.

refresh

refresh : function()

You should always provide some kind of refresh function so that your shift can correct itself for resize operations, window size changs, showing, hiding, etc.

onFocus

onFocus: function()

Do any updating of the shift’s interface here.

unfocus

Tell ShiftSpace we want to blur this shift.

onBlur

onBlur: function()

Do any updating of the shift’s interface here.

getMainView

getMainView : function()

Returns the main view of the shift.  Without this ShiftSpace cannot order the shift.

Returns

ShiftSpace.Element

mainViewIsVisible

mainViewIsVisible : function()

Returns whether the main view is visible or not.

Returns

boolean

pin

pin : function(element,
pinRef)

Pins an element of the shift to a node on the page.

Parameters

elementthe Element to be pinned.
pinRefA pinRef JSON object created by ShiftSpace.Pin

See Also

ShiftSpace.Pin

unPin

Unpins an element of this shift from a element on the page.

setPinElement

setPinElement: function(newEl)

Set the element of the shift that will actually be pinned.

Parameters

newElThe element of the shift that will be pinned.

getPinElement

getPinElement: function()

Returns the current element that is pinned.  This will return null if the shift is not currently pinned.

setPinRef

setPinRef : function(pinRef)

Set the current pinRef object.  This is normally called automatically you should rarely if ever call this directly.

Parameters

pinRefSet the current pinRef object.

getPinRef

getPinRef : function()

Returns the set pinRef object if this shift has one.

getEncodablePinRef

getEncodablePinRef: function()

This returns a version of the pin reference object that is encodable.  This is necessary because we store dom node references in the pin reference and these should not get encoded on Shift save.

Returns

And encodable JSON representation of the pin reference object.

setPinTarget

setPinTarget: function(pinTarget)

Sets the pin target.  This is the element on the page that has been targeted by the user.

Parameters

pinTargetA DOM node.

getPinTarget

getPinTarget: function()

Returns the current pin target if there is one.

setPinTargetStyles

setPinTargetStyles : function(newStyles)

When replacing a target node or being inserted before or after it is important to pick up some of the CSS dimensions of that target node.  In the case of replacing these styles need to be saved before the node is replaced and removed from the page DOM.

Parameters

newStylesA JSON object of saved CSS dimension styles.

getPinTargetStyles

getPinTargetStyles : function()

Returns the JSON object of the target nodes CSS dimension styles.

isPinned

isPinned : function()

Returns true if this shift is currently pinned.
